module.name: symbolization_by_schematic_element
module.keywords: module, class, library, schematic element, symbolization

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to record a symbolization relationship between a schematic element and a thing that is symbolizes.
purpose.note: An application program can use a symbolization relationship to provide access to information. A user may select a schematic element within a schematic drawing in order to access information about the thing that is symbolized.

li.p: the definition of a schematic element;
the identification of a schematic element within a library so that it can be referenced from outside the library;
the definition of a schematic element by reference to an external library;
a symbolization relationship between a schematic element in a library and the thing that it symbolizes.
the occurrence of a schematic element on a drawing.
li.note: The occurrence of a schematic element on a drawing is within the scope of the Schematic drawing application module.

description.p: The Symbolization_by_schematic_element UoF specifies a symbolization relationship between a schematic element and a symbolized thing.

ul.li: each individual physical realisation of the schematic element symbolizes the thing; or
each individual physical realisation of the schematic element symbolizes a member or subclass of the thing, which shall be a class in this case.

aa.refpath: symbolization_by_schematic_element<= presented_item_representation presented_item_representation.item-> presented_item=> symbolized_item symbolized_item.item
